I had a default REJECT in the scope to start with but not in the
mid-fetch =
or writer processor phase. I also tried adding those in as
the first rule f=
or them but with no success. The
ContentTypeMatchesRegexpDecideRule is conf=
igured as accept with the
regex for xml content type. I got the idea from a=
 previous post but
configured to just accept html content. 
http://tech.gro=
ups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/2824

-Shawn

--- In archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> Do you have a RE=
JECT rule first that applies to everything, then the 
> ContentTypeMatchesR=
egExpDecideRule to ACCEPT the right kind of content?
> 
> Otherwise, the de=
cision of the decide-rules will be ambiguous (PASS), 
> and in the case of =
Processor decide-rules, anything but a REJECT allows 
> the Processor to ru=
n. (See Processor.process().)
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> lpeterus wrote:
> > H=
i!
> > 
> > Thanks for the reply. I did have a ContentTypeMatchesRegExpDeci=
deRule
> > under the writer processor section with the following regex
> > =
(?i)application/xml.*
> > But it still seems to be writing the text/html pa=
ges from dynamic
> > URLs. Did I use the wrong type of expression? Thanks.
=
> >

:

ypeMatchesRegExpDecideRule o
